newsitem.title: USA: DUPONT TO TAKE UP TO $1 BLN WRITE-OFF FOR VENTURE.
newsitem.headline: DUPONT TO TAKE UP TO $1 BLN WRITE-OFF FOR VENTURE.

text.p: DuPont Co said Thursday it expects to take a one-time, non-cash charge to write off in-process research and development, which is not expected to exceed $1.0 billion.
The charge is in connection with DuPont's alliance with and investment in Pioneer Hi-Bred International Inc.
Going forward, DuPont said it would expect 1998 earnings dilution of less than two percent.
DuPont said it intends to fund the transaction with cash flow from operations and borrowings, as approprite.
Earlier, DuPont and Pioneer Hi-Bred said they agreed to form a research alliance and a separate joint venture company for the discovery, development and delivery of new crops.
As part of this agreement, DuPont will invest $1.7 billion in Pioneer, ultimately owning 20 percent of it stock for $104 a share. It also will have two of the 15 seats on Pioneer's board.
